meanings.definition: The action of being rescued or set free.
meanings.sent1: The deliverance of the lost hiker was a relief to everyone involved.
meanings.sent2: The deliverance of the hostages was a moment of joy for their families.
meanings.sent3: The deliverance of the cat stuck in the tree turned into a neighborhood event.
meanings.sent4: The deliverance of the trapped miners was like a ray of sunshine in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The deliverance of the bird with a broken wing touched the hearts of all who witnessed it.

meanings.definition: The act of delivering or distributing something.
meanings.sent1: The deliverance of the packages was done swiftly by the courier.
meanings.sent2: The deliverance of the mail is an essential service provided by postal workers.
meanings.sent3: The deliverance of the pizzas to the party guests made everyone's stomachs growl.
meanings.sent4: The deliverance of the newspapers in the morning is a routine many look forward to.
meanings.sent5: The deliverance of the groceries to the elderly couple was greatly appreciated.

meanings.definition: The state of being saved or protected from harm.
meanings.sent1: The deliverance of the child from the burning building was a miracle.
meanings.sent2: The deliverance of the soldiers from enemy fire was a testament to their training.
meanings.sent3: The deliverance of the cookies from being eaten by the dog was a close call.
meanings.sent4: The deliverance of the fragile vase from falling off the shelf was a lucky catch.
meanings.sent5: The deliverance of the rare book from the floodwaters was a preservation of history.
